fieldsOfStudy: Business Administration with a concentration in Sports Management

headline: U.S Department of Homeland Security
summary: Masters Business Administration professional with educational experience in business oversight, hands on business operations, and providing excellent client service. âª Eager to utilize undergraduate degree in Business Management and acquired technical knowledge in a management, compliance, or administrative role within the federal government.âª Proven established interpersonal and presentation skills âª Excellent written and verbal communication âª Experience with prioritizing and scheduling âª Strategic thinker âª Skilled in problem solving and  simultaneous multiple high-priority taskingâª Background and experience working in multi-cultural, goal-oriented and deadline-driven environments

defaultPosition.description:
â¢ Provide administrative support in one or more of the mission support areas which includes public affairs, finance, property, human resources, file management and budget.

â¢ Performs office automation work and using computer software, spreadsheets, databases, and graphics, to produce, store and retrieve a variety of documents including maintaining tracking systems of transactions.

â¢ Extracts, compiles and manipulates reports and data to determine if trends or patterns exist.

â¢ Analyze administrative date from a variety of sources to develop trends, patterns, profiles, estimates and studies.

â¢ Assists in responding to and interacting with the public to convey standard information on the mission of the Bureau.

â¢ Represents the executive office dealing with vendors and personnel from administrative support organizations.

â¢ Drafts and develops information material to employee to inform and maintain awareness of agency plans and programs.

â¢ Prepares overtime budget reports for each pay period.

â¢ Maintains records, and processes payments of invoices. 

â¢ Ensures the departments performance work plans for all employees are maintained, up to date and accurate. 

â¢ Extracts information for use in, and format reports and develops needed charts and graphs for the purpose of reviewing trends and initiating or changing programs. 

â¢ Drafts and formats document, and compiles Information on the various administrative programs assigned to the organization.

â¢ Ensures requests have all required information and managements approval.

â¢ Resolves processing discrepancies with the appropriate manager or supervisor. 

â¢ Provides information regarding various HR procedures. 

â¢ Ensures that performance standards and ratings are given to all employees, and that ratings are processed. 

â¢ Reviews training requests to ensure forms are complete. 

â¢ Assist users in the organization with software, and other automation problems.

positions.title: Mission Support Assistant

positions.description:
â¢ Providing immediate response to breaches of security and/or emergency situations; taking appropriate steps to prevent entry to secure areas. 

â¢ Conducting or assisting staff and law enforcement officers with conducting investigations of incidents. 

â¢ Prepare incident reports when law enforcement is involved

â¢ Making suggestions to improve security processes and procedures

â¢ Perform passive observation and engage in voluntary encounters with the public to determine whether individuals may be involved in harmful activities against transportation systems.

â¢ Use seasoned experience and knowledge of the work and governing law, regulations, policy, and procedures, to independently complete the majority of work without the need to refer issues to a superior for a decision.

â¢ Develop an understanding of the anticipated composition of travelers associated with flights or other modes of transportation, and the behaviors to be expected and assess deviations from those behaviors.
positions.title: Behavior Detection Officer

positions.description:
ADMINISTRATION

â¢Resolved simple, informal complaints of employees and referring others such as formal grievances and appeals to the supervisor, or an appropriate management official; and serving as coach, facilitator, and negotiator in coordinating team initiatives and in consensus building activities among team members.

â¢Provide input to supervisors and managers concerning a variety of human resources matters. Assisted and coached less experienced employees in the performance of their work. Assisted in the development of all employees to reach optimum performance standards. Take on other collateral duties as necessary and assigned

â¢Assisted management and Law Enforcement Officers with inquiries for information or investigations that may be initiated against a regulated party; participating in information briefings concerning sensitive information. Developed preliminary incident information for officers and superiors, and writing various types of communications, reports, and documents that are germane to the work performed.


SECURITY

â¢Provided security and protection of air travelers, airports and aircraft in a courteous and professional manner. Monitored the flow of passengers through the checkpoint to facilitate the orderly and efficient processing of passengers. Was frequently called on to resolve security issues at the checkpoints and baggage. Provided assistance to supervisory transportation security officers.
positions.title: Transportation Security Officer

positions.description:
Assisted the head coach with the process of teaching high school athletes the fundamental and techniques,in physical and mental skill execution of the game of basketball.

â¢Developed drills and practice methods to increase student's skills as well as their understanding of the game.

â¢Encouraged students to develop teamwork skills and to use good conduct when representing the school at games and competitions.

â¢Coordinated and supervised the transportation of students and equipment to various locations for games.

â¢Met with other coaches to learn new coaching methods, changes to the rules, and new procedures that will be implemented during games.
positions.title: Assistant JV & Varsity Basketball Coach

positions.description:
ADMINISTRATION

â¢Performed general program support work for the Georgia Dome information services. Provided public relations and/or marketing support activities for the Georgia Dome including making use of public relations tools such as brochures, audio-visual materials, and equipment to present during sporting events. 

â¢Served as a knowledge base for campus events. Was required to have a thorough knowledge of building policies, procedures and event requirements. general administrative duties within various departments


CUSTOMER SERVICE

â¢Performed daily activities to support the operations of the Georgia Dome including security, sales, inventory, and/or equipment maintenance. Received and directed callers and visitors. Provided information about the Georgia dome including its functions, activities, and planned events. 

â¢Provided guest information via phone inquiries. Provided ADA services and information to guests with disabilities and administers tours within the Georgia Dome.


SECURITY

â¢Acted as a member of the emergency evacuation team by communicating with and directing guests during a facility emergency. Attended all required training sessions including maintaining certification for Techniques for Effective Alcohol Management
positions.title: Guest Service Specialist
